intro: Lepigonum campestre, commonly known as field lespedeza, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of North America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, pink to reddish flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Lepigonum campestre is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity.
